description: Sphera is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up. Sphera is also the Emperor's most feared artificial prison planet and the player happens to be one of its inmates. Sent there by a scheming business partner he wants no more than escape and get his revenge. The player gets his chance when suddenly a supply ships breaks down and before it can be repaired the player takes control of it. Now the goal is to fight through the game's three levels full of defence droids and guard ships and find freedom. The gameplay is typical of the genre. The player controls his space ship and has to shoot down the many enemies that appear around him. The player has an energy bar indicating how much damage he can take from enemy fire. When it's empty or he collides with an enemy ship he loses a life. The player starts with five lives and can earn more. Other pick-ups include energy and weapons. There is an end boss for each level and these include a giant crab and a scorpion.
title: Sphera

description:
Miner Willy fell into a forgotten mine shaft near Surbiton and discovered a network of underground caverns left by an advanced (but now extinct) civilization. Collect all treasures before your air runs out while watching out for the nasty robotic guardians and deadly obstacles.

This is the SAM Coupé version of the classic platformer Manic Miner, remade from scratch (enhanced graphics, stereo soundtrack), with 40 new levels in addition to the original set of 20.

sample_screenshots.caption: Central Cavern - updated original level, appearing in first set of levels.
The Control Room - from the third level of the game.
Front screen - with 3 different level selections available

title: Manic Miner

description: Boing! is a platformer similar to the Dizzy series. The player takes control of Boing, a green blob whose time machine has crashed in a strange world full of weird and nasty creatures. To be able to get his time machine working again and leave, he has to locate and collect a number of items that lies scattered around the lands: twenty potions, a crystal, a battery and a lever. The game world consists of a number of interconnected screens and can be explored in any order. As in the Dizzy series, puzzle solving is a central part of the game. This involves picking up items and then using them at the right locations. The player has an inventory that is limited to three items. Enemies wander around the world in predefined patterns and although they don't directly attack the player, they deal damage when contact is made. There's no combat in the game and enemies can not be killed so the player has to avoid them by jumping over them. In addition to enemies the player has to watch out for spikes and long falls to avoid instant death. After dying the player has to restart the game from the beginning as there are no save points.
title: Boing!

description:
Earth is under siege by the 'Bugs United Terrorist Team' (B.U.T.T.) led by the evil Dr. Gub who is looking to take complete control of the planet. The only hope lies in the hands of the 'Bird Organization To Terminate 'Orrible Monsters' (B.O.T.T.O.M.). Now one of it's recruits, the player, has to penetrate the B.U.T.T. HQ and destroy Dr. Gub and his hoard of creatures.

Exodus is an arena shooter similar to Smash TV. The player spawns in an area full of enemies which he has to shoot while being on the lookout for crisps packets. For each level, five packets of crisps have to be collected and they are made available in direct relation to the number of enemies that are destroyed. The player can move in multiple directions and automatically shoots in the direction faced. By holding the fire button the direction of fire is locked. Various power ups can be collected, including extra lives, increased speed and multi-directional fire. New enemies keep arriving from entrances at the sides of the screen.

The game can be played alone or with two players in co-op. In a two player game both players have to collect five packets of crisps.
title: Exodus

description:
Lost disks of SAM is a SAM Coupé conversion of the ZX Spectrum game Lost Tapes of Albion.

The main character Moebius is a "renowned collector of intergalactic tat." After having collected lost Speccy tapes in the last game, Moebius realises that "no self-respecting tat-collector could be complete without a set of SAM Coupé games that never were released" and sets out on a dangerous platform adventure.

In a single screen platform game like they were done in the arcades in the early eighties, you control Moebius as he runs between the eight floors of each of the twelve levels, filled with floppy disks and dangerous nasties of four kinds. The floors are connected to the left and right, so that running off-screen to the right puts you on the left of the platform below, or on the top platform if you happen to be on the bottom floor. Most of the time, though, it is better to use the teleport platforms interspersed throughot the floors, where you push up or down to move to the platform below or above. This is needed in order to avoid the nasties patrolling each floor, ranging from the mindless Chomper to the robotic Homer which turns your way whenever you're on the same platform, or the mindless but very speedy Pucky, which seems to be modeled on the Coupé mascot SAM the Robot.

Between levels are short sequences showing the recovered disk and Moebius changing into a new suit for the next level. The game has also been remade for the Amiga as Moebius Goatlizard.

sample_screenshots.caption: The green ones are Homers, they turn at you whenever you're on their platform

title: The Lost Disks of SAM

description: This is a clone of Shanghai for the SAM Coupé. The basic gameplay is the same as the classic variant, with the tiles stacked in a kind of pyramid with extra rows at the top and bottom, requiring care when deciding in which order to remove pairs. However, there are three different arrangements to try out as well: flat, three rows and four heaps.
title: Shanghai

description: Snake Mania is a variant of the arcade game Nibbler by Rock-Ola. Like that game it is a snake game that is played inside a maze where the objective is to eat all the dots while avoiding crashing into the snake's tail. As the snake eats the dots it grows in size which makes the game increasingly harder. This variant is more puzzle oriented than the original featuring a slower pace and the snake does not move forward automatically. The mazes are tight with little extra space when the snake reaches full growth meaning it is necessary to plan ahead. To complete a level the snake has to eat all dots in the maze. The game is timed and the player has two minutes to complete each level. It is game over when the player has lost all three lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: A life is lost when crashing into tail
Snake grows as it eats dots

title: Snake Mania

description: Craft is a puzzle game where the player is presented with a number of tiles where each piece has a part of a circuit. The objective is to create a complete circuit from an entry point to an exit so that each piece of circuit is connected to another. To do so each tile can be rotated and it is also possible to move a full row of tiles horizontally. Upon completing a puzzle the player progresses to another one. Each puzzle differs in size as well as complexity of the circuit. The game is timed and if a level is not completed quick enough a life is lost. In total the player has five lives and when they are all gone the game is over.
title: Craft

description:
Dyadic is a compilation consisting of two games:

  • Craft
  • Snake Mania

Both games were also sold separately.
title: Dyadic

description:
Impatience is a compilation of two games not released separately: Triltex and The Viking Game.

Triltex is a variant of mahjongg solitaire with some additional features added. The player is presented with a number of tiles layered on top of each other and the aim of the game is to have them removed by matching tiles with the same symbol and colour. To match a tile it has to be visible but unlike other mahjongg solitaire games it does not need to have free space to the sides. If the player gets stuck he has to use the quit button and replay the level while losing a life. Extra lives are given for every 20,000 points reached or by completing a level within a time limit. Some special tiles exist which affect other tiles when matched. There are bombs which destroy four neighbours, twirlers which rotates adjacent tiles and flippers which swap the positions of tiles.

The Viking Game is based on the board game Tafl and is played by two players (no AI option exist). One player has 24 black pieces while the other has 12 white ones plus one king. The white pieces are located in the centre of the screen while the black ones are located by the sides. The white's objective is to move the king piece to one of four corners of the board. The black's objective is to capture the white king by placing black pieces on all four sides of the king. The pieces move like a rook in chess, any number of steps either horizontally or vertically, and are captured by being sandwiched by pieces of the other colour.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Viking Game - start of game

title: Impatience

description: Parallax is a side scrolling shoot 'em up set in outer space. It is similar to the game Sidewize in that enemies appear in waves of different formations and the player has to shoot down as many of them as possible without colliding with them or getting hit by any of their projectiles. Initially the player's ship shoots single bullets at a time but by clearing out a full wave of enemies it's possible to get a power up that gives multiple shots. The kind of shot to use can be selected before starting out. Enemies appear from all sides of the screen and it's of important to find the right safe spot before they arrive. Any collision leads to a life being lost. The game has twelve levels and each one ends with a boss fight against a powerful guardian enemy.

sample_screenshots.caption: Another one coming in a different formation

title: Parallax

description:
The Witching Hour is a puzzle platformer. The player can choose to control either a witch called Gretta or a wizard called Beardy. The game takes place in a small village by the sea that has been raided by ghosts and demons led by the evil demon master. Many villagers have been captured and those that escape have come to the player who is the only person with the magical power needed to rescue them. But it has to be done before midnight so the player only has one hour, the witching hour, to complete the mission.

The player controls the character with direct control like in other platform games but the game is more focused on puzzle solving than precision jumping. The player can move back and forth between the locations while avoiding dangers and interacting with characters and objects. Jumping and moving around is done with the joystick while pressing a button brings up a menu that is used for all other interactions. Similar to an adventure game, the following six commands can be used: pick up, drop, talk, use, examine and give. Most puzzles involve using an object at the right location or giving it to the right character. Only two objects can be carried at the same time.

sample_screenshots.caption: All interactions are done with this menu

title: The Witching Hour
